melvin/womanwalkingawire 1 recommended resources youtube links for invisible join & standing stitches by crystals and crochet youtube link for extended double_crochet by tamara kelly @ moogly blog for more reading about extended stitches extended stitches https //www edieeckman com/2023/11/12/extended-crochet-stitches/ notes when a round starts with a new color i use standing stitches this is why you won t see me instructing you to start with chains you can start with a chain of equivalent height if you prefer half_double_crochet=ch2 double_crochet=ch3 edc/treble_crochet=ch4 but i think the standing stitch looks best see recommended resources for videos on how to make standing stitches chains between stitches do not count in the stitch count of a round unless otherwise directed or noted they are chain spaces chsps why do i tell you join at the end of some rounds it s my personal preference to make an invisible join when i fasten_off fo because i think it looks cleaner you can choose to do whichever method you prefer see recommended resources for videos on how to make an invisible join watch out on the corners of the triangle they are irregular corners meaning there are combinations of stitch heights in the corner chsps the original bunting i made lived outside and over the course of a year it started to curl in on itself so when i decided to write this pattern i really wanted something that could stand up to the elements and be more durable the dowels i m using are plain wooden craft dowels that are 1/8-inch thick & 12-inches long they can easily be substituted with something similar in structure like kabob skewers or wires the wire cutters/diagonal cutting pliers are
